channel.title: Blogs on Shellby Johnson: R Projects
channel.description: Recent content in Blogs on Shellby Johnson: R Projects

item.title: California Spatial Analysis
item.description: library(tidyverse) library(sf) library(tmap) library(mapview) library(raster) #read in data #dsn tells r which working directory to find the file in, but we use a "." which says we're already here # "layer =" is everything that starts with ca_eco so it reads all the spatial data files that start with that at one time ca_eco <- read_sf(dsn = ".", layer = "ca_eco") %>% dplyr::select(US_L3NAME) %>% rename(region = US_L3NAME) %>% st_simplify(dTolerance = 100)%>% #reduces the number of points that make up the polygon st_transform(crs = 4326) #crs = coordinate reference system #rmapshaper:: ms_simplify() plot(ca_eco) 3.

item.title: Population Growth Rates
item.description: 1. Calculate dN/Ndt Annual population data provides some initial population size at some year (t) and subsequent population sizes for each year afterwards. With these quantities, you can calculate the logistic per capita growth rate of a population when you take the natural log of the population size (at one year in the future) divided by the initial population size. Manual Calculation of dN/Ndt from 1963-1964 for each of the 5 countries.

item.title: Snowshoe Hare Physical Data
item.description: library(tidyverse) library(janitor) library(kableExtra) library(here) library(dplyr) library(stargazer) ###Read in Data snowshoe <- read.csv("showshoe_lter.csv") This markdown document contains code that explores Snowshoe hare (Lepus americanus) data collected in Bonanza Creek Experimental Forest. Data was collected from 1999-2012 and obtained from the Long Term Ecological Research portal. I’m interested in seeing if there is a relationship between age and snowshoe hare weight (g) and hindfoot value (metadata indicated that this variable was a dimensionless real number).

item.title: Vegetable Nutrients: PCA
item.description: library(tidyverse) library(here) library(janitor) library(naniar) library(VIM) library(skimr) library(ggfortify) credit: yahoo!Finance This markdown document contains code that explores nutritional variables related to vegetables and vegetable products. Data was sourced from the USDA National Nutrient Database (also known as Food Data Central). I will be exploring the correlation between several nutrients within this particular food group (i.e. energy, vitamin A, carbohydrates, etc). To explore this, a principal components Analysis (PCA) was completed.
